sceneDescription.title: Ursus Breaking the Bull's Neck in Arena

setting.time: 64 AD, deep night, fog rising from Tiber River
setting.location: Arena in Circus of Nero, sand floor surrounded by roaring crowd
setting.weather: Clear evening with arena torches creating dramatic lighting, dust kicked up by fighting

characters.appearance: Ursus the Lygian giant, massive muscular build, blonde hair wild from battle, eyes blazing with protective fury
characters.clothing: Simple leather tunic torn from struggle, bare arms showing incredible strength, no armor or weapons needed
characters.position: Standing over defeated German aurochs in center of arena, Lygia freed behind him
characters.action: Having just broken the bull's neck with bare hands, roaring victory cry, protecting his princess from death

scene.mainElements: Stone bridge with torch posts creating spheres of light in fog, Tiber River flowing invisibly below, mist swirling around flame sources
scene.details: Arena torches creating dramatic lighting on impossible scene, crowd stunned into momentary silence, massive dead aurochs with broken neck lying in sand, Lygia's ropes cut and fallen away, blood and dust mixed in arena floor, Christian symbol of fish traced in sand near Lygia
scene.background: City completely invisible beyond fog wall, only torch halos marking human presence, river sounds indicating water below but not visible
scene.atmosphere: Miraculous moment when divine strength defeats imperial cruelty, arena transformed from place of death to scene of salvation, crowd witnessing impossible victory of faith over empire, breath held in awe of God's power

composition.cameraAngle: Medium shot from bridge center showing torch halos disappearing into fog
composition.focus: Guard figures barely visible as silhouettes in torch-lit fog spheres
composition.depth: Foreground torch with bright halo, middle ground guard emerging from mist, background complete white fog void
